page.title: 01 RURAL ABERDEENSHIRE
page.content: The village of Maud is in Banff Buchan bounded roughly by the towns Peterhead, Fraserburgh, Turriff and Ellon.One half of the village lies in the parish of New Deer and the other in the parish of Old Deer. Maud is twenty eight miles beyond Aberdeen and lies in a hollow valley well off the beaten track of the tourist, yet at the very heart of the area famed for its beef cattle and broad humour, and the barley which has ousted the great industry of oats. The buildings are in granite and there is a strong community spirit which is reflected in support for local organizations.Within this village and others lie the origins of the Bothy Ballads which commemorate the hardships and simple pleasures of early farming life.
